results.title: Shoalwater: up for grabs
results.creator_credit: David Bradbury, Helen Stickley-Thompson and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: This film is about a group of people fighting for the preservation of Shoalwater Bay (Queensland). With its sweeping bays, untouched golden beaches, its jungle and rainforest, 200 metre high sand-dunes (purported to be the oldest in the world), Shoalwater Bay is home to a multitude of birds, plants and wildlife. But this is all under threat due to both the Federal and Queensland State Governments issuing exploratory sandmining leases to several Australian and Japanese mining companies - the justification being the potential creation of jobs. However, there are many who would dispute the actual number of jobs which will become available and who argue that this unique part of Queensland’s coastline must be preserved at all costs. Produced by Award-Winning Documentary filmmaker, David Bradbury and narrated by Peter Garrett (of Midnight Oil fame).

results.title: Shoah: second era
results.creator_credit: Claude Lanzmann and Les Films Aleph
results.brief_description: Director Claude Lanzmann’s ‘Shoah’ (the Hebrew word for destruction or annihilation), attempts to create in the present the reality of the Holocaust through the memories of its survivors, both victims and perpetrators. This remarkable documentary achieves this without a single use of archival or found footage, rather letting the horror of the Holocaust resonate through the myriad of stories and the faces of the survivors. Lanzmann and his documentary crew take their subjects through the now abandoned fields and buildings of their past torment, as they recount and talk the viewer through the unknowable and unthinkable. Images such as disused train tracks, overgrown with grass and leading nowhere take on a chilling and profound resonance as we are left to contemplate what happened there. (Awards: Winner of the 1985 New York Film Critics Circle Award and the 1985 National Society of Film Critics Awards-USA)

results.title: Shellshocked
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Jane Ramsey and Ramsey Films
results.brief_description: Four very different Australian veterans of the Vietnam war, all permanently affected by shellshock, return to Vietnam as part of the process of healing the trauma they suffered. This documentary follows the veterans as they travel together, flashing back to their individual war stories which are illustrated with unique home video footage. The high moment of the film occurs when they meet with veterans from the other side: ex Viet Cong guerrillas who, just like the Australian vets, are suffering from post-traumatic stress. A film about redemption that provides some startling insights into the nature of war.

results.title: Shirt factory
results.creator_credit: Hazel Swift and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: A reaction, expressed in dance and mime, to a school visit to the local shirt factory; a protest at the monotony of piece work. Adapted from an original stage production for an end of term concert at Markfield Secondary School, North London.

results.title: Shirley MacLaine's inner workout (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Wiese and Higher Self Seminars
results.brief_description: There is no escaping stress in our world, that’s why “Shirley MacLaine’s inner workout” is such a breakthrough. It’s a workout for mind, body and soul that’s every bit as important as daily exercise. It’s a comprehensive workout using meditation and relaxation techniques practiced for centuries in the Orient. Each meditation focuses on specific emotional areas such as creativity, control, love, sexuality, power, communication, judgement and more.

results.title: She's a woman: a media portrait
results.creator_credit: Marianne Latham, Sue Cram, Peter Beilby and Film House Tv
results.brief_description: This documentary deals with the issue of the way women are represented by the media, particularly television, whether it be in advertising, news items, drama series, quiz show hostess or contestant. Stereotype roles even carry down to children who feature in television advertising. However, it also covers the gradual breaking down of the traditional rules of sex roles including women in sport, women employed in male occupations, women becoming members in male dominated clubs and entering those hallowed domains which once used to be reserved for men only. Includes interviews with Bettina Arndt, Abigail, Dr Patricia Edgar, Phillip Adams, Patsy Adam Smith and others and contains advertising images, archival footage (including the Melbourne Cup fashion parades and Miss Australia Quest) and early newsreels. Although made in 1984, it is still very relevant and of great historical value. Narrated by Sigrid Thornton.

results.title: Shchors
results.creator_credit: Oleksandr Petrovych Dovzhenko and Kiev Film Studio
results.brief_description:
A depiction of the exploits of the Ukrainian civil war commander Nikolai Shchors (under whom director Dovzhenko served). The film opens during the 1918 German intervention in the civil war. Ukrainians partisans form a brigade known as the Boguns and join with the Tarashchansk regiment to oppose German and Rada forces. Thematically, the film is a heroic mission, a quest and biography of a civil war leader who was a Bolshevik icon. Stalin commissioned this film to be made and took a participatory role in the film’s production and direction. A protracted shoot proved taxing to Dovzhenko who was forced to submit every creative idea and episode for political approval. Despite its socialist-realist approach, the film contains poetic and memorable images typical of Dovzhenko’s style.

Credits: Director, writer, Alexander Dovzhenko ; photography, Y. Ekelchik ; music, Ukrainian State Symphony Orchestra.
Cast: Yevgeni Samoilov, Ivan Skuratov, N. Nikitina, L. Lyashenko.

results.title: Shinbone Alley
results.creator_credit: John Wilson, Preston M. Fleet and Fine Arts
results.brief_description: Adapted from the “Archy and Mehitabel stories” by Don Marquis with screenplay based on the musical book “Shinbone Alley” by Joe Darion and Mel Brooks, this wonderful animated feature brings with it all the atmosphere and style of its original broadway production, and much more. Its uniqueness is in the ink and paint animation technique blended with a jazzy musical comedy style and an eclectic mix of character personalities including Archy (Eddy Bracken), the philosophic newspaper journalist who after drowning himself comes back as a cockroach reincarnate; Mehitabel (Carol Channing) the sassy, indomitable and occasionally scandalous alley cat and friend of Archy’s; Big Bill (Allen Reed, Sr.) top cat and hell-bent on winning the affections of Mehitabel; and Tyrone T. Tattersall (John Carradine) the charming theatre cat who just loves to ham it up. Whimsical, weird, funny, sometimes dark, but with a fabulous music score by George Kleinsinger supported by the Fine Arts Hollywood Orchestra conducted by George Kleinsinger, the film is more directed at the older child or teenage/adult level. The voice characterisations are simply superb, and the support cast, which includes Hal Smith, Joan Gerber, Ken Sansom, Sel Delano and the Jackie Ward singers as the alley cats, are terrific. Also features Byron Kane as the narrator.

results.title: Sharking
results.creator_credit: Rod Rees, Terry Walker and Educational Media Centre, RMIT
results.brief_description: A history of the shark and of shark fishing and marketing in Australia. Shows the historical development of the Australian shark industry and the detailed research and managemnet of shark fishing resources being carried out byy the Victorian Fisheries and Wildlife Department.

results.title: Sherlock Holmes faces death. Sherlock Holmes' secret weapon. Shelock Holmes and the voice of terror.
results.creator_credit: John Rawlins, Roy William Neill and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Three classic Holmes stories in this one compilation features Basil Rathbone as Sherlock Holmes and Nigel Bruce as Dr. Watson. Holmes, created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, uses his powers of observation to outwit daring criminals. In this series of films, made during World War 2, Holmes and Watson played out their adventures in a contemporary setting defeating evil Nazis, traitors and dastardly villains.
